meanings.definition: The state or quality of being fuzzy or unclear.
meanings.sent1: The fozinesses of the old photograph made it hard to recognize the people in it.
meanings.sent2: The fozinesses of the TV screen made it difficult to read the text.
meanings.sent3: The fozinesses of the cat's fur after rolling in the dirt was quite comical.
meanings.sent4: The fozinesses of her memory felt like trying to see through a fog.
meanings.sent5: The fozinesses of the dream left her feeling disoriented and confused.

meanings.definition: The act of becoming fuzzy or unclear.
meanings.sent1: The fozinesses of the image on the screen happened suddenly.
meanings.sent2: The fozinesses of the radio signal made the music sound distorted.
meanings.sent3: The fozinesses of the story's plot twist caught everyone by surprise.
meanings.sent4: The fozinesses of the situation clouded his judgment.
meanings.sent5: The fozinesses of the paint job gave the room a dreamy atmosphere.
